title: Running a 5K: Connecting $z$-Score and Probability
question_text: Recently, Marco participated in a 5K race involving more than $1{,}000\text{ runners}$ . Finishing times for the race were approximately normally distributed, and Marco's $z$ -score for his time to complete the race was $-0.33$ . Approximately what percent of the runners in this race did Marco finish before?
